Online weekly assignments

There is no reference to live session attendance affecting the course score or grades. The course content includes recorded video lectures, self-tests, and practice assignments available weekly, but attendance in live sessions is not listed as part of the assessment criteria.

column1: How many credits are required to get Degree
column2:
To earn a degree in the program, the following credit requirements must be met:

BSc Degree: 114 credits
BS Degree: 142 credits
Breakdown:
Foundation Level: 32 credits
Diploma Level: 54 credits
BSc Degree Level Courses: 28 credits
BS Degree Level Courses: 28 credits
To get the BSc degree, you must complete 114 credits, including foundation, diploma, and BSc level courses.
To get the BS degree, you must complete 142 credits, which includes additional courses at the BS degree level.
Note:

The Minor in Economics and Finance can be earned only with the BS degree and is included within the 142 credits for the BS degree.
Apprenticeship credits (0/4/8/12 credits) are part of the BS degree level courses.
For more detail, see the section "3.1 Definition of credit in the program" in the "Courses in the programme" document.

column1: what are the core pairs
column2:

Software Engineering and Software Testing
Artificial Intelligence and Deep Learning
These pairs are mandatory as part of the 28 credits required at the BSc Degree level.

Otherwise, standard fees apply.
If you are an Army child and wish to confirm any special concessions, it would be best to contact the program administration directly for clarification.

column1: what is second attempt in qualifier how it is different from reattempt
column2:
Second Attempt in Qualifier Exam
The Second Attempt refers to the candidate's opportunity to take the qualifier exam a second time within the same term after the initial attempt.

It is available if:

The candidate was eligible but absent for the first qualifier exam.
The candidate failed the first qualifier exam attempt.
The candidate does not need to repeat the 4-week coursework and assignments again for the second attempt.

Second attempt exams are held twice per term: after Week 4 and after Week 8.

There is a fee for the second attempt, which is lower than the full qualifier exam fee:

Category	Second Attempt Fee
General / OBC	Rs. 1500
SC / ST / PwD (≥ 40% disability)	Rs. 750
SC/ST + PwD (≥ 40% disability)	Rs. 375
Reattempt in Qualifier Exam
Reattempts generally refer to candidates who did not become eligible to take the qualifier exam after the 4-week qualifier process because they did not meet the weekly assignment score criteria.
Such candidates must:
Repeat the full 4-week qualifier coursework again.
Pay the full qualifier exam fees.
They are treated as a fresh applicant.
There is no limit on the number of reattempts a candidate can take, but each time it involves repeating coursework and paying full fees.
This applies also to candidates who fail or miss the exam after the validity of their qualifier score expires.

column1: Which subjects have 3 credits
column2:
According to the information provided in the document "Courses in the programme.md," the credits are based on the UGC system where 1 credit corresponds to 14 hours of learner engagement and 1 credit in this system equals 3 credits in the IITM campus credit system.

Courses are generally described with total credits rather than individual course credit breakdown in the excerpts. There is no explicit list given of courses with exactly 3 credits in the documents shared.

However, from the structure:

Foundation level courses total to 32 credits for 8 courses, averaging 4 credits per course, so likely not 3-credit per course.
Diploma level courses are listed as 23 credits per 6 courses plus 4 credits for 2 project courses.
Level 3 and 4 courses have fees given per credit (Rs 2500/credit for level 3, Rs 5000/credit for level 4), but no specific course has 3 credits mentioned.
Therefore, the documents do not explicitly specify which individual courses are 3-credit courses. Most courses appear to be structured either as 4 or more credits or as part of a set of courses totaling credits.

If you want a more specific answer on credit allocation per course, please provide a detailed course credit list or specify a course name.

column1: What are the eligibility criteria for the Data Science course?
column2:
The eligibility criteria for the Data Science course in the BS in Data Science and Applications program from IIT Madras depend on the entry level:

Entry Through Foundation Level:

There are no explicit eligibility criteria mentioned for joining the Foundation Level courses.
Learners can start from Foundation courses and progress through Diploma and Degree courses.
All 8 Foundation courses must be completed before registering for Year 2 Diploma level courses.
Direct Entry into Diploma Program:

Students who have completed 2 years in any undergraduate degree program are eligible to apply for direct entry into the Diploma level (either Diploma in Programming or Diploma in Data Science).
The second year marksheet or higher is required as proof.
Candidates need to pass a qualifier exam (Direct Admission to Diploma - DAD) specific to the Diploma in Data Science program.
The DAD-DS qualifier exam is a 4-hour test covering English, Maths 1, Statistics 1, and Python programming.
Candidates passing the qualifier can start from Year 2 Diploma level courses directly.
Additional notes:

For direct entry students who complete the Diploma in Data Science, they are eligible to pursue the Diploma in Programming without a qualifier.
Students starting from Foundation level must complete all Foundation courses, Diploma courses, and projects before progressing to Year 3 Degree level courses.

column1: end term eligibility criteria
column2:
The eligibility criteria to appear for the end term exam vary slightly depending on the course. Below are the summarized eligibility criteria for the end term exams from the Diploma level courses:

General Eligibility Criteria for End Term Exam:
Students must achieve a minimum average in weekly assessments (usually the best 5 or 6 out of the first 7 or 10 weekly assessments) equal to or greater than 40/100.
Students must attend at least one of the in-person quizzes (where applicable).
For some courses, passing certain programming or practical components is mandatory.
Specific Examples from Various Diploma Courses:
Database Management System (DBMS)

Average of best 5 out of first 7 weekly assessments ≥ 40/100.
Must attend at least one of the two in-person quizzes.
Application Development - 1 (App Dev 1)

Average of best 5 out of first 7 weekly assessments ≥ 40/100.
Must attend at least one of the two in-person quizzes.
Programming Concepts Using Java

Average of the best 5 out of the first 7 weekly assessments (objective and programming) ≥ 40/100.
Must attend at least one of the two quizzes in the centre.
System Commands

Average of best 5 out of first 7 weekly assessments (objective and programming) ≥ 40/100.
Application Development - 2 (App Dev 2)

Average of best 5 out of first 7 weekly assessments scores ≥ 40/100.
Must attend at least one of the two quizzes in the centre.
Additional Notes:
Attending the end term exam is mandatory to get the final course grade.
Some courses require passing practical components or specific questions (e.g., Python-DB connectivity in DBMS) to be eligible for a course grade.
If a student does not meet the weekly assessment average criteria or misses the quizzes, they may be declared ineligible or required to repeat the course.
OPPE (Online Proctored Programming Exam) eligibility is governed by separate criteria such as SCT exam completion, minimum averages in specific assignments, and programming tasks.
For detailed eligibility criteria and grading rules, always refer to the official course announcements or relevant documents provided by the institute.

column1: should I pay the full fee for all the four years at once or how will be the fee collected
column2:
You are not required to pay the full fee for all four years at once. The program fee is collected level-wise or term-wise, based on the courses and credits you register for in each term.

Here's how the fee payment works:

Course-wise Payment: You pay only for the number of credits you register for each term. Fees vary depending on the level (Foundation, Diploma, BSc, or BS) and the number of credits you choose.

Level-wise Fee Structure:

Foundation level fee: Rs. 32,000 for 32 credits.
Diploma level fee: Rs. 1,25,000 for 46 theory + 8 project credits.
BSc level fee: Rs. 2.21 Lakh to 2.47 Lakh depending on credit combinations.
BS level fee: Rs. 3.25 Lakh to 3.87 Lakh depending on credit combinations.
Term-wise Course Registration:

Each year has 3 terms (Jan-Apr, May-Aug, Sep-Dec).
You register for courses each term within your Course Completion Capacity (CCC).
You pay fees online for the courses registered in that term.
Fee Waivers and Education Loan: Waivers based on category and income are available. SBI education loans are also facilitated if needed.

So, the fee is collected incrementally as you progress through the course levels and register for courses each term, not as a lump sum for all four years at the beginning.

For more details, you can check the "Fees for the entire programme.md" and "Course registration - steps involved.md" documents.

column1: what is the fees structure for internation student
column2:
For international students, the fee structure consists of two components:

Course Fee (as applicable to all students):
The course fee depends on the level of study and number of credits registered. For example:

Foundation Level: Rs. 32,000
Diploma Level: Rs. 1,25,000 (for 2 diploma terms)
BSc Level: Rs. 2.21L – 2.47L (varies based on courses)
BS Level: Rs. 3.25L – 3.87L (varies based on courses)
Facilitation Fee (specific for students outside India):
This fee is in addition to the course fee and varies by country and the number of exams.

Component	Fee (Rs.)
Quiz 1	Rs. 2000 (regardless of number of courses)
Quiz 2	Rs. 2000
End Term Exam (1 course)	Rs. 2000
End Term Exam (>1 course)	Rs. 4000
Kuwait / Bahrain (may vary)	Rs. 3000
Example: For 4 courses, the total facilitation fee would be Rs. 8000 (Rs. 2000 + 2000 + 4000).

Note: Facilitation fees are subject to periodic revision depending on the local exam partner.

Summary:

International students pay the regular course fees plus an additional facilitation fee for exams conducted outside India.
Facilitation fees cover quiz and end term exams and vary based on the number of courses registered.
Exact facilitation fees may vary by country.
If you need specific country-wise fees or more details, you may contact the program's support.

column1: I have Taken Double Drop for JEE and have Enrolled in IIT Madras BS Data Science so what to fill in Highest Education Attained and in Current Details Section?
column2:
Since you have taken a Double Drop for JEE and have enrolled in the IIT Madras BS in Data Science and Applications program, here's how you can fill the details:

Highest Education Attained:
If you have completed your 12th standard (or equivalent) before enrolling in the BS program, you should fill your highest completed education level as 12th Standard (or equivalent).
If you are currently in your 12th or equivalent, you can mention the last completed education level, like 10th Standard, since you haven't completed 12th yet.
Current Details Section:
You should mention your current enrollment as "Enrolled in BS in Data Science and Applications at IIT Madras".
You can also specify that you are pursuing an undergraduate level program online with examination centers for quizzes/exams at designated places.
This aligns with the program's eligibility and enrollment information shared in the documents, which accepts learners from any background and allows them to study the BS program online.

If you need to specify a particular academic level, you can mention it as "Undergraduate program - BS Data Science and Applications" under current studies.

column1: what is the difference between I grade and I_OP
column2:
The difference between the I grade and I_OP grade is as follows:

I Grade (Incomplete)
Given when the student is absent for the End Term (ET) exam alone but has completed all other assessment components such as quizzes, OPPEs, projects, and weekly assignments.
Student can register to take the ET exam alone in the subsequent term.
OPPE and quizzes will not be scheduled again for the student.
All other marks for the final course score will be carried over from the previous run.
I_OP Grade (Incomplete OPPE)
Given when the student has failed in the OPPE (Online Proctored Programming Exam) but has written the ET exam and crossed the cutoff for the total score (T) as per the course grading policy.
Student can register to do the OPPE alone in the next term.
If the course has one OPPE, that single OPPE will be scheduled; if it has two, both OPPEs will be scheduled.
Student can attempt the OPPE alone.
All other mark components of the final course score from the previous run (ET and quizzes) will be carried over and not scheduled again.
Summary
Grade	When it is given	What to do next	Assessments to be retaken
I	Absent for End Term exam only	Register and take ET exam alone in next term	Only End Term exam
I_OP	Failed OPPE but passed End Term with cutoff	Register and take OPPE alone in next term	OPPE(s) only
You can also choose to repeat the entire course instead of only the pending components in both cases.

column1: Can I take Python before completing Computational Thinking
column2:

The course Intro to Python requires Computational Thinking (CT) as a prerequisite.
This means you cannot take Intro to Python before completing Computational Thinking. You must complete Computational Thinking first or at least register for it before you can take the Intro to Python course.

column1: can a working professional apply for direct entry diploma
column2:
Yes, a working professional can apply for direct entry into the Diploma programme. This pathway is primarily aimed at working professionals or learners who already possess the fundamentals taught in Year 1 of the programme and wish to enter the Diploma level directly.

Key points:

Eligibility: Students who have completed 2 years in any undergraduate degree programme can apply for direct entry into the diploma level by submitting their second-year marksheet or higher as proof.
Admission Process: Candidates need to pass a separate Direct Admission to Diploma (DAD) qualifier exam which is conducted three times a year.
Passing the qualifier allows registration for the Diploma courses.
There is no limit on the number of attempts for the qualifier exam.
Fees apply for the qualifier exam as per category.
For more details, see the "Direct Entry into Diploma programme" section in the guidelines.

column1: what about placement support
column2:
Placement support is provided for students in the last term of both diplomas and the degree level. According to the May 2025 term announcements:

There will be 2 career counseling sessions per week.
Students can book a slot in these sessions to discuss their career choices with the instructors.
A form will be circulated before the sessions to schedule personalized interactions based on individual requirements.
This means that students nearing completion of their program receive personalized career guidance and support through these scheduled counseling sessions. Please keep an eye on course announcements for updates regarding these sessions and how to book your slot.

column1: how much credits can be transfered from NPTEL COURSES
column2:
A maximum of 4 credits can be transferred from NPTEL courses under the HS/MG (Humanities/Social Sciences/Management) category at the BS degree level.

For other categories at the BSc or BS levels, NPTEL courses can also be credited, but:

Each NPTEL course can be credited only once and to only one program (not credited twice).
NPTEL courses of different durations correspond to different credit equivalences in the BS program:
4-week course = 1 credit
8-week course = 2 credits
12-week course = 3 credits
Additional points:

The maximum credits that can be transferred from any on-campus or external courses (including apprenticeships and NPTEL) is limited as per program guidelines.
Fee for credit transfer from NPTEL is Rs 1000 per credit.
Summary:

Maximum 4 credits transferable from NPTEL under HS/MG category at BS level.
Other NPTEL courses can be credited based on duration and category, subject to program limits.

column1: What eligibility is required to apply for a direct entry diploma
column2:
To be eligible to apply for Direct Entry into the Diploma programme, the following criteria must be met:

The candidate must have completed 2 years in any undergraduate (UG) degree programme.
The candidate must submit their second year marksheet or higher as proof of having completed 2 years of the UG degree.
This pathway is aimed at working professionals or learners who already possess the fundamentals taught in Year 1 of the programme and want to enter the Diploma level directly.

column1: How can I apply for IITM BS Degree Program?
column2:
To apply for the IIT Madras BS in Data Science & Applications degree program, you should follow these general routes based on the available information:

1. Start from Foundation level (Basic pathway)
Anyone interested can start by enrolling in Foundation level courses delivered online.
After completing required foundation courses, you progress through Diploma levels, then BSc level, and finally the BS degree.
The program content is delivered online; quizzes and final exams are conducted in person at designated centers.
2. Direct Entry into Diploma Programme (for those with prior qualifications)
If you have completed 2 years of any undergraduate degree program, you are eligible to apply for direct entry into the Diploma level.
You must take and pass the Direct Admission to Diploma (DAD) qualifier exam.
Passing this exam grants eligibility to join the Diploma program directly.
3. Credit Transfer (if applicable)
If you have completed relevant courses (like NPTEL courses or campus courses at IITM or other institutions) you can apply for credit transfer towards the BS degree.
Credit transfer has specified rules and fees; NPTEL courses must be registered and paid through your official IITM email and credits can be counted once.
How to Apply
Specific application procedures are usually available on IIT Madras official portal for the BS program.
You may need to register on the IITM online education platform or fill out application forms when admissions are open.
For direct admission to the Diploma level, register for the DAD qualifier exam on the scheduled dates.
Follow IITM notifications and announcements for start dates, examination centers, and detailed admission processes.
Summary:
Enroll from the Foundation level and progress to BS degree, or
If you qualify, take the Direct Admission Diploma qualifier exam and enter at the Diploma level.
Utilize credit transfer options if you have completed related courses.
Complete necessary exams and course credits as per the BS degree curriculum.
For more details, you can visit the IIT Madras BS program official website or contact their support team.

column1: Is there a scholarship option available?
column2:
Yes, there are scholarship options available in the form of fee waivers based on category and family income. Here are the details:

Fee Waivers Based on Category and Income
Category	Family Income > 5 LPA	Income >1 LPA and <= 5 LPA	Income <= 1 LPA
General	Full Fee (No documents required)	50% waiver (EWS + Income proof)	75% waiver (EWS + Income proof)
OBC	Full Fee (No documents required)	50% waiver (OBC-NCL + Income proof)	75% waiver (OBC-NCL + Income proof)
SC / ST	50% waiver (SC/ST proof)	50% waiver (SC/ST proof)	75% waiver (SC/ST + Income proof)
PwD	50% waiver (PwD proof)	50% waiver (PwD proof)	75% waiver (PwD + EWS/OBC-NCL + Income proof)
SC/ST + PwD	75% waiver (proof)	75% waiver (proof)	75% waiver (proof)
Suitable fee waivers are also available for the Qualifier exam fees for SC/ST and PwD categories.
The fee waivers require submission of relevant proofs for category and income where applicable.
If you belong to any of these categories or meet the income criteria, you can avail of these waivers which effectively act as scholarships.

For more details, you may contact the program coordinators or refer to the fee waiver section in the program documents.

column1: Eligibility criteria to appear for the end-term exam.

column1: Quiz 2 is there for Stats 2
column2:
Yes, Quiz 2 is scheduled for the course "Statistics for Data Science 2."

Quiz 2 Date: August 03, 2025
End term exam date: August 31, 2025
Both are to be attended in person at designated centres.
Eligibility to write the final exam requires:

An average of the best 5 out of the first 7 weeks of weekly assignment scores >= 40/100
Attendance in one of the 2 quizzes (Quiz 1 or Quiz 2)
The final course score T is calculated as follows for eligible students:

GAA = Average score in First 10 weekly graded assignments
Qz1 = score in Quiz I (0, if not attempted)
Qz2 = score in Quiz II (0, if not attempted)
F = score in final exam
Bonus marks for Extra activity (capped to 5)
Formula:
T = 0.1GAA + max (0.6F + 0.2max(Qz1, Qz2), 0.4F + 0.2Qz1 + 0.3Qz2) + Bonus marks for Extra activity

Bonus marks details:

Total 5 marks: 3.75 marks for weekly extra activity + 1.25 marks based on quality (faculty discretion)
Peer review is required for extra activity submission.

So, Quiz 2 for Statistics 2 is indeed scheduled and is part of eligibility and grading.

column1: syllabus for python
column2:
The syllabus for the course "Intro to Python Programming" as part of the BS in Data Science and Applications (May 2025 term) is covered over the term weeks and assessed through various assignments, quizzes, and programming exams.

While the exact detailed syllabus topics are not explicitly listed in the available documents, here is the assessment and exam schedule and academic policies related to the Python course which give an idea about the course structure and evaluation:

Assessment and Exam Schedule for "Intro to Python Programming":
Quiz 1: July 13, 2025 (In-person at designated centres)
Quiz 2: Not applicable
End Term Exam: August 31, 2025 (In-person at designated centres)
Online Proctored Programming Exams (OPPE):
OPPE1: July 20, 2025
OPPE2: August 24, 2025
Possible additional OPPE dates: August 27, 28 (7 PM to 9 PM)
Eligibility Criteria:
Eligibility for appearing in OPPE1 and OPPE2 requires completing a System Compatibility Test (SCT) for OPPE.
To appear for OPPE1, students must score at least 40/100 in Grading Programming Assignments (GrPA) in weeks 1 to 4.
To appear for OPPE2, students must score at least 40/100 in GrPA in weeks 5 to 8 and have an average of best 5 out of 7 weekly assessments ≥ 40/100.
Eligibility for the end term exam requires average of best 5 out of the first 7 weekly assessments ≥ 40/100.
To obtain the course grade, students must attend the end term exam and score at least 40/100 in one of the two programming exams (OPPE1/OPPE2).
Academic Policies:
Taking help from Large Language Models (LLMs) such as ChatGPT or Gemini in programming assignments is considered plagiarism and a violation of the honour code.
Assignments are expected to be done individually based on one's understanding.
Sharing assignments before deadlines is prohibited.
Evaluation Formula for Final Course Score (T):
GAA1 = Average score of objective assignments (first 10 weeks)
GAA2 = Average score of programming assignments (first 10 weeks)
Qz1 = Score in Quiz 1
PE1 = Score in OPPE1
PE2 = Score in OPPE2
F = Score in final end term exam
Final score:

T = 0.1 * GAA1 + 0.1 * GAA2 + 0.1 * Qz1 + 0.4 * F + 0.25 * max(PE1, PE2) + 0.15 * min(PE1, PE2)
Further details:
Students will be allocated specific slots for OPPE exams depending on their eligibility.
The SOP for the OPPE System Compatibility Test (SCT) is provided in a linked document.
Students should keep the dates for quizzes and exams free.
Weekly assignments and quizzes up to week 10 contribute to eligibility and grading.

column1: How can I apply for IITM BS Degree Program?
column2:
To apply for the IIT Madras BS in Data Science & Applications degree program, here are the key points you need to know:

Program Overview
The BS in Data Science & Applications program by IIT Madras is delivered online allowing you to study from anywhere.
Quizzes and final exams require in-person attendance at designated centres.
You can progress through levels: Foundation Certificate → Diploma in Programming/ Data Science → BSc Degree → BS Degree.
Pathways and Entry
If you are starting fresh, you typically enter at the Foundation Level and move up by completing courses.
Alternatively, if you have prior qualifications, there are pathways to directly enter at higher levels like Diploma (refer to "Direct Entry into Diploma Programme" for eligibility and process).
Steps to Apply
Visit Official IITM Website: For the latest admission notifications and application forms.
Select Entry Level: Choose whether you start at Foundation Level or Diploma Level if you have prior qualifications.
Register and Pay Fee: Complete registration and pay the required fees.
Qualify exams if applying for Diploma directly: You may need to pass a qualifier exam if you seek direct entry to Diploma level (for those with prior studies).
Complete Online Courses: Study the online course materials as per the program curriculum.
Appear for In-Person Exams: Attend monthly quizzes and final exams at designated centers.
Progress through Program Levels: Successfully complete required credits to earn Diploma, BSc, and eventually the BS Degree.
Important Notes
The program is designed for flexible online study, suitable for learners worldwide.
Foundational courses build up your skills to pursue advanced diplomas and degrees.
Students can earn multiple credentials as they progress.
For detailed information, refer to the intro document on BS Data Science & Applications and [Direct Entry into Diploma Programme](#Direct Entry into Diploma programme.md) for eligibility and further application details.

If you have prior credentials or specific conditions, additional pathways such as credit transfer or re-entry policies may apply.

column1: what are the subjects in foundation level.
column2:
The subjects (courses) in the Foundation level are as follows:

Maths 1
Statistics 1
English 1
Computational Thinking (CT)
Maths 2 (Pre-requisite: Maths 1)
Statistics 2 (Pre-requisite: Statistics 1; Co-requisite: Maths 2)
English 2 (Pre-requisite: English 1)
Introduction to Python (Pre-requisite: Computational Thinking)
All these 8 Foundation courses should be completed before registering for Diploma level courses.

column1: i have discrepancies in my graded assignments scores
column2:
If you have discrepancies in your graded assignment scores, you can take the following steps based on the academic policies and grading procedures mentioned in the documents:

Check Deadlines and Scores:

Verify the assignment deadlines and submission dates to ensure your assignments were submitted on time. Late submissions might not be graded.
Review the scores released for each assignment, quiz, and exam carefully.
Review Academic Policies:

Ensure that your submissions comply with the academic policies, for example, no plagiarism, no sharing before deadlines, and individual effort expected.
Violations like usage of LLMs or copied assignments may lead to penalties which might affect your scores.
Contact the Course Instructor or Support:

If you believe there has been an error in grading, raise the issue with your course instructor or the support team.
Provide details such as assignment numbers, submission timestamps, and the discrepancy you noticed.
Use Official Communication Channels:

Follow the procedures as per the course communication for dispute resolution or grade re-evaluation if available.
Keep Records:

Keep copies of your submitted assignments and correspondence for reference.
If you need specific help or contact details, please check your course portal or announcements for the grievance redressal process.

column1: Is there a scholarship option available?
column2:
Yes, there are scholarship options available in the form of fee waivers based on category and family income. The fee waivers are as follows:

Category	Family Income > 5 LPA	Family Income > 1 LPA and <= 5 LPA	Family Income <= 1 LPA
General	Full Fee (No documents required)	50% waiver (EWS + Income proof)	75% waiver (EWS + Income proof)
OBC	Full Fee (No documents required)	50% waiver (OBC-NCL + Income proof)	75% waiver (OBC-NCL + Income proof)
SC / ST	50% waiver (SC/ST proof)	50% waiver (SC/ST proof)	75% waiver (SC/ST + Income proof)
PwD	50% waiver (PwD proof)	50% waiver (PwD proof)	75% waiver (PwD + EWS/OBC-NCL + Income proof)
SC/ST + PwD	75% waiver (proof)	75% waiver (proof)	75% waiver (proof)
Waivers require submission of relevant proofs such as income certificate, caste certificate, disability certificate, etc.
The fee waivers apply to the Qualifier exam fees and subsequent programme fees.
For more details and to apply for the waivers, you may need to present your category and income documents during application or admission.

Additional financial support:

SBI education loan facility is available with an interest rate starting at 8.10% with no collateral required until course completion, which might help students financially.
If you need guidance on how to apply for these waivers or loans, please let me know!

column1: What are the courses offered in Diploma in Data Science?
column2:
The Diploma in Data Science offered in the program includes the following courses:

Core Courses (6 courses)
Machine Learning Foundations (MLF)
Machine Learning Techniques (MLT)
Machine Learning Practice (MLP)
Business Data Management (BDM)
Business Analytics (BA)
Tools in Data Science (TDS)
Project Courses (2 projects)
Project course in Business Data Management
Project course in Machine Learning Practice
These courses together make up the Diploma in Data Science.

column1: Fee structure for Data Science program with fee waiver.
column2:
Fee Structure for the BS in Data Science and Applications Program (with Fee Waivers)
Overview of Fees
The program is structured in levels:

Foundation level (32 credits)
Diploma level (54 credits) – Diploma in Programming and/or Data Science
BSc degree level (28 credits)
BS degree level (28 credits)
Fees by Level (Approximate):
Level	Fee (Rs.)
Foundation	32,000
Diploma (both)	1,25,000
BSc	Rs. 2.21L – 2.47L
BS	Rs. 3.25L – 3.87L
Note: The BSc and BS fees vary according to course and credit selections.

Entry Fee for Qualifier Exam
Rs. 3000 (non-refundable)
Suitable waivers available
Fee Waivers Based on Category and Family Income
| Category | Family Income > 5 LPA | Income > 1 LPA & 5 LPA: 50% waiver → Rs. 16,000

PwD with income <= 1 LPA: 75% waiver → Rs. 8,000
Similar proportional waivers apply for fees at Diploma, BSc, and BS levels.

Summary
Qualifier Exam Fee: Rs. 3000 with possible waivers (see above)
Course Fees: Paid as per levels completed, e.g., Rs. 32k for Foundation plus Rs. 1,25,000 for Diploma, etc.
Fee Waivers: 50% or 75% waiver available for eligible categories and income levels
Education Loan: Available through SBI with 8.10% interest, no collateral
If you are eligible for a waiver, you should submit the necessary income and category proof during application to avail the waiver.

For exact fee calculation post waiver, multiply the applicable fee by the waiver fraction (e.g., 25% fee for 75% waiver).

If you need detailed fee for specific levels or combinations after waiver, please specify your category and income band.

column1: Grading Policy for PDSA ?
column2:
Grading Policy for PDSA (Programming Data Structures and Algorithms using Python) - Diploma in Programming
Course Assessments and Schedule
Weekly assignments include a mix of autograded and programming assignments.
Quiz 1: July 13, 2025 (in person at centers)
Quiz 2: August 03, 2025 (in person at centers)
End term exam: August 31, 2025 (in person at centers)
One programming exam (Online Proctored Exam - OPPE): August 17, 2025
Eligibility Criteria
To appear for OPPE 1:

Students must complete the OPPE System Compatibility Test (SCT).
Average of programming assignment scores in weeks 2 to 8 (A2 to A8) must be at least 40/100.
Detailed condition: A2 ≥ 40, A3 ≥ 40, A4 ≥ 40, A5 ≥ 40, A6 ≥ 40, A7 ≥ 40, A8 ≥ 40.
To appear for OPPE 2:

Students must complete the OPPE SCT.
Average of the best 5 out of the first 7 weekly assessments (objective and programming) ≥ 40/100.
To appear for end term exam:

Average of the best 5 out of the first 7 weekly assessments (objective and programming) ≥ 40/100.
Attendance in at least one of the two quizzes.
To get the course grade:

Attendance in the end term exam.
Scoring Components
GAA: Average score in the first 10 weekly graded assignments.
Qz1: Score in Quiz 1 (0 if not attempted).
Qz2: Score in Quiz 2 (0 if not attempted).
OP: Score in Online Proctored Exam (OPPE).
F: Score in final exam (end term).
Final Course Score Calculation
[ T = 0.1 \times GAA + 0.4 \times F + 0.2 \times OP + \max \left(0.2 \times \max(Qz1, Qz2), 0.15 \times Qz1 + 0.15 \times Qz2 \right) ]

Grade Policy Based on OPPE and End Term Exam Attendance/Scores
Case	OPPE 1/2 Status	End Term Status	Grade	Next Step
1	Absent	Absent	U	Repeat the entire course
2	Absent (OPPE scores = 0)	Present (score ≥ 35)	I_OP	Complete OPPE alone next term; GA, quiz and ET marks carried over; OR repeat course
3	Score 40	Absent	I	Complete ET alone next term; OPPE will not be scheduled; GA, quiz and OPPE marks carried over; OR repeat course
8	Present, OPPE Score ≥ 40	Present	Pass Grade as per T	
Note:

OPPE SCT exam is mandatory to appear for OPPE.
Passing the course requires attending the end term exam.
Scores and grades depend on overall performance combining weekly assignments, quizzes, programming exams, and end term exam.
If you need more detailed info or explanation on any component, feel free to ask!

column1: Tell me about internship and full time support eligibility?
column2:
Based on the provided documents related to IIT Madras’ BS in Data Science and Applications program, here is the information about internship and full-time support eligibility:

Internship Eligibility and Support
Self-Secured Internships:

Many students secure internships on their own by leveraging the knowledge from the program and displaying it on their resume.
Stipends vary broadly, with monthly stipends ranging mostly between Rs 10,000 to Rs 100,000+.
Internships via IITM BS Placement Cell (IIC):

Students can register for internship support through IIC.
Numbers show that many students become eligible for internship support and a significant number secure internships this way.
Stipends generally range from Rs 10,000 to Rs 60,000 per month (minimum Rs 10,000, median Rs 27,705, highest Rs 60,000).
Application Process:

Students register with IIC for internship support.
Eligibility criteria must be met to apply through IIC.
Number of companies and positions advertised vary by term.
Full-Time Job Eligibility and Support
Job Opportunities via IIC:

Students can also register for placement support through IIT Madras’ BS placement cell.
A number of companies advertise jobs each term, and students apply through it.
Salaries vary with a median around Rs 8,09,230 per annum and a range starting from about Rs 3,60,000.
Job Application Process:

Students register for placement support.
They apply for advertised positions.
Placement cell tracks eligibility and job offers secured.
Apprenticeship Program (Full-Time Support)
Apprenticeship is an optional program available at the BS level and allows students to work with companies or research organizations while earning academic credits (up to 12 credits).
Duration of apprenticeship:
Minimum 4 months with partial credits.
Full credits (12) for 8 months full-time apprenticeship.
Students can take a maximum of 2 courses per term during apprenticeship.
Mode of work remote or onsite depending on company.
Stipend terms mutually agreed upon with the company.
Successful apprenticeship may lead to a pre-placement offer.
Fee for credit transfer is Rs 5000 per credit, payable at registration.
Summary
Aspect	Details
Internship Support	Self-secured or via IITM’s Placement Cell (IIC) with monthly stipends Rs 10,000 to Rs 60,000+
Job Support	Via IITM’s Placement Cell, salaries ranging Rs 3.6 LPA to Rs 15 LPA+, median Rs 8.09 LPA
Apprenticeship (Full-time)	Optional 4-8 months full-time with academic credits (4 credits for >4 months, 12 credits for 8 months). Max 2 courses per term allowed. Stipend negotiable; possibility of pre-placement offer.
Eligibility for Support	Students must register for support via IIC, fulfill eligibility criteria, apply and secure positions.
If you need guidance on how to register for internships or apprenticeship or about eligibility criteria, please let me know!

column1: Can you assist me with the eligibility and requirements for placements of BS degree
column2:
The provided documents do not contain specific information about eligibility criteria or requirements for placements directly related to the BS Degree in Data Science and Applications from IIT Madras.

However, based on the general academic structure and criteria to successfully complete the BS degree, here are some key points that might indirectly relate to placement eligibility:

Academic Requirements for BS Degree:
Total Credits Required: 142 credits for the BS degree.
Completion of Levels:
Foundation Level: 32 credits (8 courses)
Diploma Level: 54 credits (12 courses + 4 projects)
BSc Degree Level: 28 credits (7 courses)
BS Degree Level: 28 credits (7 courses including apprenticeship and level 4 courses)
CGPA Requirement: Students usually need to maintain a good CGPA, often ≥ 8.0, especially if opting for advanced opportunities such as upgrading to MS programs.
Apprenticeship: Optional apprenticeship credits (4/12 credits) are part of the BS degree level, giving students industry or research exposure, which may enhance placement prospects.
Credit Transfer: Students can transfer credits from NPTEL courses or IITM campus courses under certain conditions which may affect their graduation timeline.
General Suggestion for Placement Eligibility:
Completion of the BS degree meeting all credit and course requirements.
Maintaining a good academic record (CGPA).
Completing apprenticeships or internships as part of the program to gain practical experience.
Participating in any placement-related processes announced by IIT Madras or the BS degree program coordinators.
Recommendation:
For detailed and updated eligibility and requirements for placements specific to the BS degree, please consult the official IIT Madras BS in Data Science and Applications program website or contact the program administration office directly.

If you need help with any specific academic or credit requirements or course-related queries, please let me know!

column1: What would be the average stipend and compensation for the fresher who graduate out from the IIT madras BS degree
column2:
Based on the Career Choices Report (April 2025) for IITM's BS in Data Science and Applications:

Average Stipend for Internships (for freshers)
Median monthly stipend: Rs. 27,705
Minimum monthly stipend: Rs. 10,000
Highest reported stipend: Rs. 60,000
Average Salary for Jobs (for freshers)
Median annual salary: Rs. 8,09,230
Minimum annual salary: Rs. 3,60,000
Highest reported salary: Rs. 15,00,000
Summary:
A fresher graduating from IIT Madras BS degree typically gets internship stipends around Rs. 27,700 per month and job offers with an average annual salary of approximately Rs. 8 lakh. Some students also earn considerably higher packages depending on experience and background.
